surprise, there are two hawks on the board, their wage growth hawks, so it's very likely

And then the major changes in the statement actually came in the Bank of England's forecast
of inflation on the two-year horizon and the three-year horizon now.
If you cast your mind back into the November QR report, the Bank of England was talking
Today they came out and actually lowered that forecast to 2.56, as well as obviously their
three-year forecast for inflation came down to 2.36 from 2.5.
Now the reason this is key or the reason the actual Carney sort of said the Bank of

in them revising down their inflation forecast.

So it sounded like a very flexible Bank of England today that can hike or cut rates
at this current point.
And a lot of it remains to be seen as to how things go forward with regard to
Just as a summary there, it's almost the case if we start to see excessive appreciation
in sterling, that could cause lower inflation numbers and that would keep the Bank of England
from doing anything hawkish.
And conversely, if we saw much weaker sterling, that would affect inflation to the upside
and we could then likely see the Bank of England act in a more dovish manner.
